Package org.jgrapes.core

This package defines the interfaces and classes that provide the core functionality of JGrapes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Channel
    Represents a communication bus for sending events between components.
    Component
    Marks a class as a component.
    EventPipeline
    An event pipeline is a queue of events that are sent to the components of the associated tree.
    Manager
    Provides methods for manipulating the component hierarchy and for firing events.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractComponent
    A convenience base class for new components.
    ClassChannel
    The root base class for channels that use their class (type) as key for matching channels with handlers.
    Event
    The base class for all events.
    HandlingErrorPrinter  
    NamedChannel
    A class for channels identified by a name (string).
    NamedEvent
    A class for events identified by name.
    Utils
    This class provides some utility functions.

Package org.jgrapes.core Description

This package defines the interfaces and classes that provide the core functionality of JGrapes.

The package supports some specific (java.util) logging settings.

org.jgrapes.core.handlerTracking.level
If set to FINE, causes events and their handlers to be logged before the handler is invoked. If set to FINER additionally causes events without any handler to be logged (the additional logging is done with log level FINE, just as the logging of the invocations). Enabling the invocation logging involves some performance penalty because additional information (not required for normal operation) has to be maintained.
org.jgrapes.core.classNames.level
If set to FINER, class names are converted to fully qualified names in toString() methods.
Author:
Michael N. Lipp
